intro: Ixora notoniana, commonly known as the Christmas hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Ixora notoniana thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its striking appearance and adaptability contribute to its widespread cultivation in warm climates.
